channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-761] Fix Flare license headers
item.description: Solr Flare has inconsistent use of the Apache Software License header in its files.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: FYI: ant rat-sources is helpful in easily identifying which files are missing license headers.

I've fixed up the bulk of the warnings from RAT on the flare sources. With these current exceptions:

[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/public/javascripts/controls.js
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/public/javascripts/dragdrop.js
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/public/javascripts/effects.js
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/public/javascripts/prototype.js
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/MIT-LICENSE
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/Rakefile
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/UPGRADING
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/about.yml
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/generators/plugin_migration/USAGE
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/generators/plugin_migration/plugin_migration_generator.rb

[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/plugin.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/plugin_list.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/plugin_migrator.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions/active_record.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions/dependencies.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions/migrations.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions/public_asset_helpers.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions/rails.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions/rails_initializer.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions/routing.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/rails_extensions/templates.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/lib/engines/testing.rb
[rat:report] /Users/erikhatcher/dev/solr-trunk/client/ruby/flare/vendor/plugins/engines/tasks/engines.rake

vendor/plugins/engines is a dependency of the Flare plugin, MIT licensed, as noted by flare/vendor/plugins/engines/MIT-LICENSE

public/javascripts/*.js are MIT licensed as noted in their headers.

What can we do about our RAT report to ensure these MIT licenses are noted and these files aren't flagged as license issues?
